intro: Calycosiphonia pentamera, commonly known as the five-petaled sea lettuce, is a marine green alga found in coastal areas. It belongs to the family Ulvaceae and is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus. The plant has a simple structure with a single layer of cells and lacks true roots, stems, or leaves. It reproduces both sexually and asexually through spores and fragmentation. Calycosiphonia pentamera plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
